entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as having betrayed Harry. The text describes Dumbledore's actions and intentions in relation to Harry's life.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character of the story. He reflects on his own mortality and the fact that his life was always determined by the task of destroying Horcruxes.

entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is mentioned as being tied to Harry's life through the Horcruxes. The text describes Voldemort's connection to Harry and his own mortality.

entities.name: horcruxes
entities.description: Horcruxes are objects that contain pieces of Voldemort's soul. They are central to the story and play a key role in determining Harry's life span.

relationships.description: Dumbledore's betrayal of Harry is described as almost nothing. The text suggests that Dumbledore's actions were part of a larger plan to eliminate the Horcruxes.
Dumbledore assigned the task of destroying the Horcruxes to Harry. The text describes this as part of Dumbledore's plan to eliminate the Horcruxes.
Voldemort is connected to Harry through the Horcruxes. The text describes this connection and its impact on Harry's life span.
